results.title: [Charles Hayes Home Movies: Reel 9]
results.brief_description:
The Charles Hayes Home Movie Collection is a collection of home movies originally made on 8mm and 9.5mm film between the 1940s and 1970s by Charles Edward Hayes (1914–1993). The resulting footage shows us the life of a family living in Heathmont in Melbourne’s south east with their many pets and farm animals, their family holidays and gatherings, their suburb and their cars as well as scenes from Melbourne at the time.

This film shows family holidays and recreational activities including trips to the beach, road trips to regional Victoria, children’s playgrounds (including swings and slippery slides) farm animals, pets and women’s tennis.

There is footage of Melbourne during the 1956 Olympics, showing athletes warming up, relay track events, Flinders Street and St Paul’s Cathedral with Olympic decorations.

Originally made using 9.5mm film.

Selected Highlights List (time codes from Access Overscan)

00:00:01:00 VH INB aircraft flying overhead
00:00:07:00 children and adults on swings and see-saw in playground. Great vintage sunglasses.
00:00:27:00 close-ups of children’s faces at the beach
00:00:34:00 men in 1940s bathing suits (bathers, swimwear)
00:00:45:00 children and adults standing by road signs to Healesville, Narbethong, Donna Buang, Warburton
00:00:57:00 bird’s eye view of 1940s cars on country dirt road
00:01:13:00 stationary 1940s car on dirt road, with passenger looking out window and driver posing in front of the car
00:01:18:00 wooden fire tower
00:02:09:00 children and mother walking down stone steps of picnic ground. Good fashion shots.
00:02:16:00 parked 1940s car
00:02:45:00 country look-out point with telescope and vintage car
00:02:56:00 two children posing for camera (good vintage fashion shots)
00:03:05:00 hobby farm with children and adults patting goats and cows
00:03:51:00 children in birthday party clothes
00:04:09:00 children on slippery slide
00:05:00:00 group of children posing and waving to camera (good children’s fashion shots)
00:06:07:00 farm animals and pets
00:06:42:00 1950s parked cars
00:07:40:00 1956 Melbourne Olympic Games Village showing flags and Olympic rings sign
00:07:54:00 1956 Melbourne Olympic Games athletics track and field event, relay event, including athletes from the Philippines and USA
00:08:12:00 1956 Melbourne Olympic Games street scene with Olympic rings, trams and cars on Flinders Street easterly direction
00:08:21:00 St Paul’s Cathedral with Olympic Games street decorations
00: 08:27:00 1950s Coles shopfront with John Batman quote
00:08:32:00 family members: grandfather and two children (good fashion examples)
00:08:52:00 family pet shots. Patting wire-haired fox terrier, cockatoo.
00:09:19:00 c1940/1950 Women’s doubles tennis match

results.title: [George Robinson Parsons Home Movies: Reel 2]
results.brief_description:
The George Robinson Parsons Home Movie Collection is a collection of home movies originally made on 16mm AGFA film. George Robinson (Robin) Parsons was an amateur filmmaker who made home movies on a Bolex camera during the period 1929 to 1938. The home movies show life in Melbourne and regional Victoria in the 1930s.

This film is a series of shorter films from different periods edited together. They include trips to Lake Eildon and the Eildon Weir Spillway and Dromana Beach. Streets of Ballarat and Alexandra are also briefly seen.

We see a doubles tennis tournament at Kooyong Stadium and a scene of the 1936 Australian golf exhibition tour with Gene Sarazen (USA), Jim Ferrier (Australia) and Helen Hicks (USA), the first professional female golfer in the world.

Included are members of the Parsons family, also playing tennis and golf, and towards the end of the film there is a raquet technique demonstration from Robin (George Robinson) Parsons himself.

In addition to showing fashions of the time there are brief scenes showing vehicles of the era, including a steam locomotive, ships, a row boat and horses. The two main vehicles seen are the family cars: a 1935 Chevrolet and 1933 Rover.

The film also includes a few scenes of dogs playing and doing tricks including the family terrier called Peter.

results.title: [Charles Hayes Home Movies: Reel 6]
results.brief_description:
The Charles Hayes Home Movie Collection is a collection of home movies originally made on 8mm and 9.5mm film between the 1940s and 1970s by Charles Edward Hayes (1914–1993). The resulting footage shows us the life of a family living in Heathmont in Melbourne’s south east with their many pets and farm animals, their family holidays and gatherings, their suburb and their cars as well as scenes from Melbourne at the time.

A short film which features the early stages of construction of the West Gate Bridge in Melbourne made more dramatic by being filmed from overhead, through a window of an airplane.

We see a Trans Australia Airlines (TAA) airplane in the film, one of Australia’s domestic airlines between its inception in 1946 and its merger with Qantas in September 1992.

There are also scenes of life at home in Heathmont in Melbourne’s southeast, including family members modelling dresses, menswear and tennis gear for the camera.

Originally made using Standard 8mm film. Note that the film goes unexpectedly dark for several seconds at 00:2:12:00.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:02:00 landing gear of a plane filmed through a window during takeoff
00:00:13:00 landing gear retracting as plane rises into the air
00:00:28:00 residential areas in Melbourne (likely to be Essendon) filmed from overhead
00:00:35:00 views of each end of the Westgate Bridge during construction
00:01:17:00 a container ship in Port Phillip Bay
00:01:40:00 plane landing gear being lowered
00:01:54:00 passengers alighting from a TAA airplane on the tarmac (likely a Lockheed Electra Mk2 Aircraft)
00:02:44:00 women of the family modelling dresses walking toward the camera
00:03:25:00 showing the pets in the garden
00:04:23:00 the camera pans out over the residential fringe, capturing a view of the Dandenong Ranges in the distance
00:05:24:00 a view of the front of the Heathmont family home
00:05:31:00 women of the family modelling bathing suits of the day walking from and toward the camera
00:05:56:00 a classic car model from the 1940s

results.title: [George Robinson Parsons Home Movie Collection]
results.brief_description:
The George Robinson Parsons Home Movie Collection is a collection of home movies originally made on 16mm film. George Robinson (Robin) Parsons was an amateur filmmaker who made home movies during the period 1929 to 1938. This collection of home movies, made on a Bolex camera using 16mm AGFA film, was donated to ACMI by his nephew, Chris Parsons.

The home movies show life in Melbourne and regional Victoria in the 1930s.

results.title: [Charles Hayes Home Movies: Reel 3]
results.brief_description:
The Charles Hayes Home Movie Collection is a collection of home movies originally made on 8mm and 9.5mm film between the 1940s and 1970s by Charles Edward Hayes (1914–1993). The resulting footage shows us the life of a family living in Heathmont in Melbourne’s south east with their many pets and farm animals, their family holidays and gatherings, their suburb and their cars as well as scenes from Melbourne at the time.

This is a composite film of different segments – a family reunion at Halls Gap in 1973 where we see typical barbeques of the era – a small round three legged hotplate and a ‘trough’ style both stacked with 1970’s barbeque fare – lots of lamb chops. We also see the fashions of the 1970’s in the velvets, flares, knee high socks and long hair. ‘Sandown Park with Jack Brabham’ introduces a segment of vintage racing cars and favourite car driver of the day, Jack Brabham signing autographs and smiling at the camera.

The film also includes some Moomba parade floats and marching girls, some city scenes of Melbourne and the Yarra Heliport and Ansett-ANA helicopter and finishes with some up close footage on the set of ‘World of Sport’, a very popular television sports show of the era featuring Lou Richards, Jack Dyer and Ron Casey among others.

Originally made using Standard 8mm film.

results.title: [George Robinson Parsons Home Movies: Reel 1]
results.brief_description:
The George Robinson Parsons Home Movie Collection is a collection of home movies originally made on 16mm AGFA film. George Robinson (Robin) Parsons was an amateur filmmaker who made home movies on a Bolex camera during the period 1929 to 1938. The home movies show life in Melbourne and regional Victoria in the 1930s.

This film shows an example of life in Victoria, Australia, just prior to the Second World War. Much of it revolves around members of the Parsons family and friends who are clearly not camera shy. In a number of scenes, you can see individuals playing up to the camera. There is even a staged boxing match on the beach where Robin (George Robinson) Parsons experimented with using special effects.

The film shows several Victorian locations including Melbourne, Dromana, Rosebud Aerodrome, Cape Schanck, Mt Hotham, Mallacoota, Wangarrata and Yallourn. Dromana Beach is featured a few times and appears to be a family favourite for swimming and family gatherings.

This film is rich with fashion of the period, both casual and formal, including two weddings of different periods and golfing attire.

Included in the film is the 1935 centennial celebrations parade showing crowded street with brass bands travelling down Collins Street, including a brief scene of an Aboriginal float. Much of these scenes are taken from the rooftop of Parsons Bros and company building. The company would later form Uncle Toby’s.

The film also includes the Shrine of Remembrance, St Pauls cathedral, Princes Bridge and many other Melbourne landmarks including some buildings and sites that no longer exist.

Of interest are the many forms of transport that are seen throughout which include cars, trams, horses, bicycles, motor bike with side carriage, a canoe, bi planes, fighter planes, a gyrocopter, the Saro A17 Cutty Sark seaplane (only 12 were ever created), transport planes, steamboats, tugboats, a navy ship, locomotives and a Melbourne ferry.

Also of interest is a scene from the 1939 Australian Championship at Kooyong Stadium with John Bromwich and Adrian Quist.

In a number of scenes, you can see individuals playing up to the camera. There is even a staged boxing match on the beach where Robin (George Robinson) Parsons experimented with using special effects.

The film shows several Victorian locations including Melbourne, Dromana, Rosebud Aerodrome, Cape Schanck, Mt Hotham, Mallacoota, Wangarrata and Yallourn. Dromana Beach is featured a few times and appears to be a family favourite for swimming and family gatherings.

This film is rich with fashion of the period, both casual and formal, including two weddings of different periods and golfing attire.

Included in the film is the 1935 centennial celebrations parade showing crowded street with brass bands travelling down Collins Street, including a brief scene of an Aboriginal float. Much of these scenes are taken from the rooftop of Parsons Bros and company building. The company would later form Uncle Toby’s.

The film also includes the Shrine of Remembrance, St Pauls cathedral, Princes Bridge and many other Melbourne landmarks including some buildings and sites that no longer exist.

Of interest are the many forms of transport that are seen throughout which include cars, trams, horses, bicycles, motor bike with side carriage, a canoe, bi planes, fighter planes, a gyrocopter, the Saro A17 Cutty Sark seaplane (only 12 were ever created), transport planes, steamboats, tugboats, a navy ship, locomotives and a Melbourne ferry.

Also of interest is a scene from the 1939 Australian Championship at Kooyong Stadium with John Bromwich and Adrian Quist.

results.title: [Charles Hayes Home Movies: Reel 2]
results.brief_description:
The Charles Hayes Home Movie Collection is a collection of home movies originally made on 8mm and 9.5mm film between the 1940s and 1970s by Charles Edward Hayes (1914–1993). The resulting footage shows us the life of a family living in Heathmont in Melbourne’s south east with their many pets and farm animals, their family holidays and gatherings, their suburb and their cars as well as scenes from Melbourne at the time.

This film contains some of the Hayes family favourites – their assorted pets including the star of many of the films, Ticka the cockatoo, their farm animals and views of the areas surrounding their home in Heathmont. There is also a brief visit to the beach.

A feature of the film is some early views of Ringwood shops and traffic including good examples of cars of the day and the very new looking ‘Holden Bill Paterson Motors’. Bill Paterson was a successful racing car driver of his era. We also see advertising signs of the day such as ‘Whelan the Wrecker’ and ‘Dickies’ and a vintage ‘red rattler’ train crossing the Yarra so likely to be the Port Melbourne/St Kilda line now a lightrail.

Originally made using Standard 8mm film.

results.title: [Douglas Wilson Home Movies: Reel 2]
results.brief_description:
Douglas Wilson (1919–1980) was an amateur filmmaker whose films are a snapshot of Australia in the 1950s to 1960s. Douglas’s home movies captured aspects of life in Australia’s major cities as well as in regional areas, often with a focus on public areas, transport or infrastructure projects. A collection of his films has been donated to ACMI by a member of Douglas’s family.

This film captures some of the highlights of Sydney in 1962 – the harbour and bridge, memorials, gardens, building sites and streets and historic houses, as well as people working, fishing, playing bowls, sailing and catching ferries. There is a focus on traffic and cars around the inner Sydney area such as a wonderful scene of a double decker bus and taxis of the era.

Originally made using 16mm film.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:10:00 title ‘Sydney 1962’
00:00:14:00 a man is wandering around the Sydney University campus
00:01:00:00 views of Sydney whilst driving through traffic
00:01:34:00 Lennox Bridge at Parramatta.
00:01:44:00 a sign for Windsor followed by footage of historic houses
00:03:22:00 Sydney Harbour Bridge and ferry
00:06:31:00 Sydney Anzac Memorial
00:06:46:00 City Bowling Club
00:07:09:00 Sydney ‘El Alamein Memorial Fountain’
00:07:20:00 scenes at ‘Vaucluse House’
00:07:54:00 yachts sailing around the harbour
00:08:38:00 an Ansett seaplane at a pier
00:08:48:00 people fishing of a small pier
00:08:56:00 Sydney double decker bus and taxis
00:10:30:00 Rural Bank of NSW building
00:11:20:00 large excavation at a building site leaving a narrow house standing to the side
00:12:05:00 ferry ‘Kooleen’ followed by scenes shot from a boat or ferry of the harbouside

results.title: [Douglas Wilson Home Movies: Reel 1]
results.brief_description:
Douglas Wilson (1919–1980) was an amateur filmmaker whose films are a snapshot of Australia in the 1950s to 1960s. Douglas’s home movies captured aspects of life in Australia’s major cities as well as in regional areas, often with a focus on public areas, transport or infrastructure projects. A collection of his films has been donated to ACMI by a member of Douglas’s family.

This film is mostly focused on the Snowy Mountains Scheme in New South Wales, an integrated water and hydro-electric power utility constructed between 1949 and 1974, located in Australia’s Southern Alps.

There are also some scenes of travel around Brisbane in Queensland.

Frequent title cards assist the viewer with detail, particularly regarding the workings of the hydro Scheme.

Originally made using 16mm film.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:10:00 title ‘Snowy Mountain Scheme 1957’
00:00:22:00 the Snowy Mountain Authority buildings
00:00:44:00 title card ‘Guthega Dam’ followed by views of the dam
00:01:45:00 views of the accommodation buildings
00:02:00:00 title card ‘Guthega Power Station’
00:02:14:00 several views of a large cement pipeline
00:02:55:00 title card ‘Island Bend’
00:03:11:00 a four wheel drive vehicle at the site
00:03:19:00 a Pioneer Express bus waiting for passengers
00:03:22:00 sign ‘Snowy Mountain Lookout’ followed by wide vistas of the mountains
00:03:44:00 title card ‘Adaminaby Dam’
00:04:03:00 trucks working in a quarry and the clearance of trees for the workings of the Scheme
00:04:50:00 workers atop a tower construction
00:05:15:00 sign for the contractors, ‘Etudes Et Enterprises’ at the T.I. power station
00:05:31:00 title card ‘Tumut Ponds’
00:05:48:00 mouths of tunnels into the mountainsides
00:06:27:00 title card ‘Cabramurra’
00:07:41:00 title card ‘Cooma Airport’
00:07:45:00 airplane for Butler Air Transport
00:08:14:00 title card ‘Queensland 1957’
00:08:19:00 Brisbane City Hall
00:08:50:00 title card ‘Mt Coot-Tha’
00:09:14:00 title card ‘Brisbane River’, followed by views of the river
00:09:55:00 ‘Koalas at Lone Pine’ followed by a koala sitting on a dog’s back, and kangaroos
00:10:35:00 ‘Glasshouse Mountains’
00:11:00:00 ‘Long Island’ and a map of the coast of Queensland showing the location
00:11:20:00 beach scenes and an open four wheel drive modified to take passengers from small boats to the shore and on to the holiday huts
00:12:24:00 fishing scenes and wooden boxes full of fish
00:12:40:00 title card ‘Visit to South Molle’
00:13:57:00 title card ‘Visit to Happy Bay’ followed by views around the beach and bay area
00:16:08:00 title card ‘Departure of Guests’ and the holiday visitors are taken on the modified jeep to a small boat, bound for the ferry

results.title: [Douglas Wilson Home Movies: Reel 4]
results.brief_description:
Douglas Wilson (1919–1980) was an amateur filmmaker whose films are a snapshot of Australia in the 1950s to 1960s. Douglas’s home movies captured aspects of life in Australia’s major cities as well as in regional areas, often with a focus on public areas, transport or infrastructure projects. A collection of his films has been donated to ACMI by a member of Douglas’s family.

In this film, we spend time around a bay that is probably Port Phillip in Melbourne. Scenes are filmed on the piers and from the piers, capturing all the activity. There are lovely scenes of yachts sailing, people watching boat races, adults and children fishing and dockside workers undertaking their jobs on the piers.

The film also contains wonderful scenes of the celebration parade for the ‘Centenary of Essendon Municipal Government’ from 1961.

Originally made using 16mm film.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:03:00 a large ship
00:00:20:00 yachts on the bay with a pier in the foreground
00:01:03:00 a large 3-sail yacht tacking in the bay
00:01:19:00 a fishing rod in the foreground
00:01:20:00 children and adults fishing off the pier
00:01:28:00 men working with a tractor and pulley on the pier
00:02:02:00 pulleys being operated to take up large chains and an anchor on a pier
00:02:57:00 closer up to some yachts
00:02:05:00 motor boats on the bay
00:03:50:00 large yacht and passengers close up
00:04:07:00 a military ship
00:04:26:00 yachts racing on the bay
00:04:42:00 an older man, wearing a classic 1940s – 1950s style hat, standing on the pier looking out across the bay
00:05:00:00 a boy wearing rolled up trousers, fishing off the pier and more lovely yachts sailing by before we see a man and another boy who is lying down on the pier alongside his fishing rod
00:05:34:00 a motor boat goes by
00:05:42:00 a young man rowing a small rowboat
00:06:12:00 women wearing wide floral skirts, sitting on beach chairs on the pier, boys fishing and a bicycle
00:06:19:00 a tugboats travels past the pier
00:06:25:00 small cars on the pier
00:06:46:00 a large ship sails into the bay
00:06:55:00 two young boys collect a wicker fishing basket and rods
00:07:24:00 large passenger ship sails close by the end of the pier where some small cars are parked
00:07:40:00 seagulls flying by
00:07:46:00 program for the ‘Centenary of Municipal Government in Essendon 1861 – 1961, official Centennial Celebration program. Saturday December 9’
00:08:00:00 a military band leads a street parade
00:08:20:00 Australian Army members march by
00:08:30:00 various ‘floats’ as well as ‘marching girls’ go by in the celebratory parade
00:08:52:00 the Girl Guides ‘World Wide Friendship’ ‘float’ goes by followed by the Essendon Football Club
00:09:25:00 the Australian Navy contingent goes by, followed by the Victorian Railways ‘float’ showing off a train carriage and a bagpipes band in full regalia
00:10:00:00 – 00:11:15:00 participants in the parade include communities dressed in traditional costumes, the local library, more marching girls, local business and associations and schools, veterans groups and the RSL, a ‘supermarket float’ and a group of horse riders
00:11:33:00 the ‘Bowmen of Essendon’ go by followed by an ‘Australian made’ stilt walker, Christmas ‘floats’ and the Scouts
00:12:05:00 the Australian Air Force, a glimpse of some walking ‘briquettes’ and some girls who might be a netball team or school group
00:12:15:00 young women modelling smart outfits of the day including hats and gloves being driven in a sports car followed by a ‘float’ for a local ‘dance hall’
00:12:45:00 ‘Home Pride Bread horse drawn van goes by with decorations and a young woman ‘baker’, followed by a giant paint tin ‘float’
00:12:53:00 a car and boat accompanied by ‘sea scouts’
00:13:07:00 ‘Essendon Brass Band’ marches by followed by the Ukraine community group in costumes and a local hospital or medical group
00:13:19:00 handmade card for ‘Essendon 1961’

00:09:25:00 the Australian Navy contingent goes by, followed by the Victorian Railways ‘float’ showing off a train carriage and a bagpipes band in full regalia
00:10:00:00 – 00:11:15:00 participants in the parade include communities dressed in traditional costumes, the local library, more marching girls, local business and associations and schools, veterans groups and the RSL, a ‘supermarket float’ and a group of horse riders
00:11:33:00 the ‘Bowmen of Essendon’ go by followed by an ‘Australian made’ stilt walker, Christmas ‘floats’ and the Scouts
00:12:05:00 the Australian Air Force, a glimpse of some walking ‘briquettes’ and some girls who might be a netball team or school group
00:12:15:00 young women modelling smart outfits of the day including hats and gloves being driven in a sports car followed by a ‘float’ for a local ‘dance hall’
00:12:45:00 ‘Home Pride Bread horse drawn van goes by with decorations and a young woman ‘baker’, followed by a giant paint tin ‘float’
00:12:53:00 a car and boat accompanied by ‘sea scouts’
00:13:07:00 ‘Essendon Brass Band’ marches by followed by the Ukraine community group in costumes and a local hospital or medical group
00:13:19:00 handmade card for ‘Essendon 1961’
description_for_label:
Douglas Wilson (1919–1980) was an amateur filmmaker whose films are a snapshot of Australia in the 1950s to 1960s. Douglas’s home movies captured aspects of life in Australia’s major cities as well as in regional areas, often with a focus on public areas, transport or infrastructure projects. A collection of his films has been donated to ACMI by a member of Douglas’s family.

In this film, we spend time around a bay that is probably Port Phillip in Melbourne. Scenes are filmed on the piers and from the piers, capturing all the activity. There are lovely scenes of yachts sailing, people watching boat races, adults and children fishing and dockside workers undertaking their jobs on the piers.

The film also contains wonderful scenes of the celebration parade for the ‘Centenary of Essendon Municipal Government’ from 1961.

Originally made using 16mm film.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:03:00 a large ship
00:00:20:00 yachts on the bay with a pier in the foreground
00:01:03:00 a large 3-sail yacht tacking in the bay
00:01:19:00 a fishing rod in the foreground
00:01:20:00 children and adults fishing off the pier
00:01:28:00 men working with a tractor and pulley on the pier
00:02:02:00 pulleys being operated to take up large chains and an anchor on a pier
00:02:57:00 closer up to some yachts
00:02:05:00 motor boats on the bay
00:03:50:00 large yacht and passengers close up
00:04:07:00 a military ship
00:04:26:00 yachts racing on the bay
00:04:42:00 an older man, wearing a classic 1940s – 1950s style hat, standing on the pier looking out across the bay
00:05:00:00 a boy wearing rolled up trousers, fishing off the pier and more lovely yachts sailing by before we see a man and another boy who is lying down on the pier alongside his fishing rod
00:05:34:00 a motor boat goes by
00:05:42:00 a young man rowing a small rowboat
00:06:12:00 women wearing wide floral skirts, sitting on beach chairs on the pier, boys fishing and a bicycle
00:06:19:00 a tugboats travels past the pier
00:06:25:00 small cars on the pier
00:06:46:00 a large ship sails into the bay
00:06:55:00 two young boys collect a wicker fishing basket and rods
00:07:24:00 large passenger ship sails close by the end of the pier where some small cars are parked
00:07:40:00 seagulls flying by
00:07:46:00 program for the ‘Centenary of Municipal Government in Essendon 1861 – 1961, official Centennial Celebration program. Saturday December 9’
00:08:00:00 a military band leads a street parade
00:08:20:00 Australian Army members march by
00:08:30:00 various ‘floats’ as well as ‘marching girls’ go by in the celebratory parade
00:08:52:00 the Girl Guides ‘World Wide Friendship’ ‘float’ goes by followed by the Essendon Football Club
00:09:25:00 the Australian Navy contingent goes by, followed by the Victorian Railways ‘float’ showing off a train carriage and a bagpipes band in full regalia
00:10:00:00 – 00:11:15:00 participants in the parade include communities dressed in traditional costumes, the local library, more marching girls, local business and associations and schools, veterans groups and the RSL, a ‘supermarket float’ and a group of horse riders
00:11:33:00 the ‘Bowmen of Essendon’ go by followed by an ‘Australian made’ stilt walker, Christmas ‘floats’ and the Scouts
00:12:05:00 the Australian Air Force, a glimpse of some walking ‘briquettes’ and some girls who might be a netball team or school group
00:12:15:00 young women modelling smart outfits of the day including hats and gloves being driven in a sports car followed by a ‘float’ for a local ‘dance hall’
00:12:45:00 ‘Home Pride Bread horse drawn van goes by with decorations and a young woman ‘baker’, followed by a giant paint tin ‘float’
00:12:53:00 a car and boat accompanied by ‘sea scouts’
00:13:07:00 ‘Essendon Brass Band’ marches by followed by the Ukraine community group in costumes and a local hospital or medical group
00:13:19:00 handmade card for ‘Essendon 1961’
